questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of muscle tissue?
questions.answer: Connective muscle

questions.question: What is the basic functional unit of muscle contraction?
questions.answer: Sarcomere

questions.question: Which theory explains muscle contraction?
questions.answer: Sliding filament theory

questions.question: What is the role of calcium in muscle contraction?
choices: It binds to troponin, exposing actin binding sites
It forms the thick filaments in sarcomeres
It lubricates the muscle fibers for smooth movement
questions.answer: It binds to troponin, exposing actin binding sites

questions.question: What is the primary function of ATP in muscle contraction?
choices: To provide energy for myosin head movement
questions.answer: To provide energy for myosin head movement

questions.question: Which part of the nervous system includes the brain and spinal cord?
questions.answer: Central nervous system

questions.question: What is the correct order of parts in a neuron from signal reception to transmission?
questions.answer: Dendrites, cell body, axon

questions.question: What is the term for the junction between two neurons?
questions.answer: Synapse

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a stage in the transmission of a nerve impulse?
questions.answer: Hyperpolarization

questions.question: What is the primary neurotransmitter at the neuromuscular junction?
questions.answer: Acetylcholine

questions.question: What is a motor unit?
choices: A group of muscle fibers innervated by one motor neuron
A bundle of actin and myosin filaments
questions.answer: A group of muscle fibers innervated by one motor neuron

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a reflex arc?
choices: Blinking when something approaches your eye
Feeling hungry when you smell food
questions.answer: Blinking when something approaches your eye

questions.question: What is the correct sequence of events in a reflex arc?
choices: Stimulus, motor neuron, interneuron, sensory neuron, response
Stimulus, sensory neuron, interneuron, motor neuron, response
Response, motor neuron, interneuron, sensory neuron, stimulus
Interneuron, sensory neuron, stimulus, motor neuron, response
questions.answer: Stimulus, sensory neuron, interneuron, motor neuron, response

questions.question: Which type of muscle tissue is found in the walls of blood vessels?
questions.answer: Smooth muscle

questions.question: What is the function of myelin in the nervous system?
choices: To insulate axons and speed up signal transmission
questions.answer: To insulate axons and speed up signal transmission

questions.question: Which part of a skeletal muscle attaches it to a bone?
questions.answer: Tendon

questions.question: What is the role of interneurons in the nervous system?
choices: To connect sensory and motor neurons
To transmit signals from the CNS to muscles
To receive sensory information from the environment
To produce hormones for the endocrine system
questions.answer: To connect sensory and motor neurons

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of the peripheral nervous system?
questions.answer: Cerebellum

questions.question: What is the function of the sarcoplasmic reticulum in muscle cells?
choices: To store and release calcium ions
To generate ATP for muscle contraction
To form the thick filaments of sarcomeres
questions.answer: To store and release calcium ions

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the all-or-none principle of muscle fiber contraction?
choices: A muscle fiber either contracts fully or not at all
All muscle fibers in a muscle must contract together
Muscles can only contract or relax, with no in-between state
Muscle contraction requires both nervous and hormonal stimulation
questions.answer: A muscle fiber either contracts fully or not at all

questions.question: What is the function of neurotransmitters at a synapse?
choices: To provide energy for signal transmission
questions.answer: To transmit signals between neurons

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of skeletal muscle tissue?
questions.answer: Voluntary control

questions.question: What is the role of the motor end plate in neuromuscular transmission?
choices: To generate action potentials in the muscle fiber
To receive neurotransmitters from the motor neuron
To pump calcium ions into the sarcoplasmic reticulum
questions.answer: To receive neurotransmitters from the motor neuron

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of the nervous system?
questions.answer: Producing red blood cells

questions.question: What is the primary difference between the somatic and autonomic nervous systems?
choices: The somatic system controls voluntary actions, while the autonomic system controls involuntary actions
The somatic system is part of the CNS, while the autonomic system is part of the PNS
The somatic system uses only chemical synapses, while the autonomic system uses only electrical synapses
The somatic system affects only muscles, while the autonomic system affects only glands
questions.answer: The somatic system controls voluntary actions, while the autonomic system controls involuntary actions

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct statement about muscle fatigue?
choices: It is caused by an excess of oxygen in the muscle tissue
It results from the accumulation of lactic acid and depletion of ATP
It only occurs in skeletal muscles, not in cardiac or smooth muscles
It is prevented by increasing the speed of muscle contractions
questions.answer: It results from the accumulation of lactic acid and depletion of ATP

questions.question: What is the function of Schwann cells in the nervous system?
choices: To form the myelin sheath around axons
questions.answer: To form the myelin sheath around axons

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the process of synaptic transmission?
choices: The direct transfer of electrical signals between neurons
The release of hormones into the bloodstream
The conversion of electrical signals to chemical signals and back to electrical signals
The movement of ions across the cell membrane
questions.answer: The conversion of electrical signals to chemical signals and back to electrical signals

questions.question: What is the primary function of motor neurons?
choices: To transmit signals from sensory receptors to the CNS
To process and integrate information within the CNS
To transmit signals from the CNS to effector organs like muscles
questions.answer: To transmit signals from the CNS to effector organs like muscles

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of a sarcomere?
questions.answer: Neurotransmitters
